clinical_study.brief_title: RESpiration deTection From Implanted Cardiac Devices in Subjects With Heart Failure (REST-HF)
clinical_study.official_title: RESpiration deTection From Implanted Cardiac Devices in Subjects With Heart Failure (REST-HF)

brief_summary.textblock:
The purpose of this prospective, non-randomized, single-arm, research study is to evaluate the accuracy of acutely extracting respiratory rate and tidal volume from implanted cardiac device impedance in subjects with heart failure.
In addition, to assess the feasibility of extracting respiratory rate from device EGM under various conditions.

primary_outcome.measure: Accuracy of extracting respiratory features from intrathoracic impedance acutely in subjects with heart failure
primary_outcome.description: Impedance-derived respiratory rate during different breathing patterns

secondary_outcome.measure: Assess the feasibility of extracting respiratory rate from EGM under various conditions
secondary_outcome.description: EGM derived respiratory rate under various conditions.
